title: The Guard (1990 film)
text:
The Guard () is a 1990 Soviet <a href="drama%20film">drama film</a> directed by <a href="Aleksandr%20Rogozhkin">Aleksandr Rogozhkin</a>. It was entered into the <a href="40th%20Berlin%20International%20Film%20Festival">40th Berlin International Film Festival</a> where it won the <a href="Alfred%20Bauer%20Prize">Alfred Bauer Prize</a>. The film is shot entirely in <a href="Photographic%20print%20toning%23Sepia%20toning">sepia</a>.
Plot.
The film is based on the real story of a Soviet <a href="Internal%20Troops">Internal Troops</a> soldier who killed his entire unit (the "karaul") as a result of <a href="Dedovschina">Dedovschina</a>. The plot unfolds mostly on board of the <a href="prisoner%20transport">prisoner transport</a> <a href="Stolypin%20car">rail car</a> guarded by a unit of paramilitary <a href="conscript">conscript</a>s.
